column3: In commit aa0e6d8ab1761d6bbc729614663da7ad7fb67dac:\n\nMy comment was just an example. It is generally not clear to me when this nullptr check should be done. Most of the other methods don't do it either. E.g. `CWallet::LoadWallet`, `CWallet::GetNewChangeDestination`, `CWallet::CreateWalletFromFile`, ...

> It is generally not clear to me when this nullptr check should be done.\n\nChecking for null key managers *should* always be done, and various commits in #17261 add more null checks. But I don't think it makes a big difference if we add null checks now (there should only be a small handful) or wait for changes from #17261. Just let me know what you prefer: dropping this commit, keeping it, or

> It is generally not clear to me when this nullptr check should be done.

I like how `GetLegacyScriptPubKeyMan helper` returns a reference instead of a pointer.

> Just let me know what you prefer: dropping this commit, keeping it, or expanding it to cover LoadWallet, etc.

I prefer expanding it.
Either drop it or expand it. It shouldn't matter

re: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17300#issuecomment-547535074 from Sjors

> I prefer expanding it.

re: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17300#issuecomment-547541329 from MarcoFalke 

> Either drop it or expand it. It shouldn't matter

This introduces 5 "warning: unused variable 'spk_man' [-Wunused-variable]"  warnings in rpcdump.

Probably harmless: though if the function should be called if the return value is not used (so it's purely side effect) it might be good to document that so people don't do the obvious thing.
